title: The cat's out of the bag...
body:
October's Moxie A Go-Go was just announced in today's paper (see here). We're co-presenting THE ROCKY HORROR PICTURE SHOW with the Landers Theatre... at their place, of course. It's going to be a blast! The Landers is selling ROCKY HORROR prop kits with rice and newspaper and all the other stuff that people toss around during a typical screening. I've never even seen RHPS, but I can easily say it's been the single most requested movie for us to play.

I'm just glad I'm not on the cleaning staff... woo hoo!
author: Dan

comments.author: Nate
comments.body: Haven't seen a good "woo-hoo!" around here in some time.

comments.author: Caleb
comments.body: Ditto on that cleaning woohoo. I will definitely go to this. Even though I really don't like RHPS that much. But I bet it will be fun.

comments.author: Al
comments.body: How much $ do you get when you "co-present" at their place.

comments.author: jOsh
comments.body: yaaaa!!!!!! is it odd that i plan on taking my mother?

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: @Al: Not much, but as with all Moxie A Go-Go's, we're doing it more for the exposure than the money. I don't think we've ever made more than $100 from a single MaGG event.

comments.author: Matthew Martin aka Master RJ
comments.body: The venue is an interesting choice since the Landers used to show movies before switching to plays.

comments.author: drtedd
comments.body:
Excellent plug in this week's Springfield Business Journal. Don Wessel digs The Moxie!

http://sbj.net/weekly_article.asp?aID=49548173.640412.969644.66248803.8263071.968&page=2

comments.author: nicole
comments.body: Aww, that was nice of Mr. Wessell!

comments.author: Chris
comments.body: RHPS?  That's such a Vandivort/Moxie film.  At the Landers?  Hmm.  I'd have expected a Sing-Along Sound of Music.  Now THAT would be cool!  (Almost as fun as the impromptu Sing-Along Mary Poppins that occurred when I was in college.)  ;D

comments.author: nicole
comments.body:
Sing-Along Sound of Music AND Mary Poppins are on my must-list as far as Moxie goes.

We're doing RHPS with Landers because they're getting rid of all their seats, and so the lower level will be empty.

comments.author: Chris B.
comments.body: How much is it gonna be per person?
